content.description: Sit start in underclings, move left as if to do direct, then bust right to little holds and a sloper top out.
content.location: This is on the left side of wall.

content.description: This is on the left side of the wall.  Sit start in undercling and move left to good holds and straight up from there.
content.location: This is on the left side of wall.

content.description: This one pulls over the bulge just right of the crack.  The crux mantle is a little scary as you rock onto a high right foot.  If the foot slips, you WILL scrape your face!  It's awkward and spooky and therefore more rewarding than some of the other problems here....
content.location:
This is just right of the crack,

Get In My Belly

.

content.description:
This is to the right of the

Classic Warm-up

. Start on a large rail, reach up and left to some crimps on the overhanging face, and pop to the lip of the overhang. From here, a crux mantle gets you to an easy topout.
The crux is getting off the ground, the rest consists of big moves to even bigger holds.
content.location: This is left of the tree and just right of a vertical dike.

content.description: This is a great little crack with nice sharp finger locks.
content.location: This is the obvious crack on the right side of the wall.

content.description: Some of these problems are pretty tall, and this one is no exception.  Luckily, lots of them get progressively easier as you move up.  Start right of the tree and follow jugs up and right.  This is probably the easiest problem here and therefore the most obvious warm-up.
content.location: This is just right of the tree in the middle of the wall.  Walk off to the left.

content.description: This is one of the more popular problems here. Sit start in a horizontal and reach up left to an impossible pinch.  Your right foot heel-toes in the starting hold to magically adhere you to the tiny holds.  It is nice to have a spotter here, so you don't land on your head when the only thing holding on is your foot.  Make a huge move up to a bigger bad hold. Carefully top out the slab above.
content.location: This is left of center on the wall left of the tree and left of the vertical dike (pretty much right under it).

content.description: This is one of the best problems here.  Move up into an undercling at the start.  You can knee bar with your left leg as you reach for the "belly button."  Make big moves to slopers with a high step or heel hook in the "belly button."  Top out with great holds, that may or may not be attached....
content.location: This is near the right side of the boulder is an awesome bulge with a big sloper in the middle.

content.description:
This is a bit contrived but quite fun.

Start on

The Buddha Belly

, from the "belly-button" dyno right to a good edge in the horizontal break, then crimp and dyno again to finish on

Get In My Belly!
